results.headline: Falling for the Anarchy She Was Sent to Fight
results.summary_short: A group of anarchists near the Mason-Dixon line are determined to hold the poisoners and polluters of the executive class accountable for their actions.

results.summary_short: “Sirius,” a documentary by Amardeep Kaleka, seeks to induce government transparency about extraterrestrial life.

results.headline: Suspending Disbelief, as 4 Flee Handcuffs
results.summary_short: “Now You See Me,” directed by Louis Leterrier, follows the exploits of a criminal group of magicians as they are pursued by a dogged F.B.I. agent.

results.headline: Uncle Sam Stands in the Way of Uncle Jack
results.summary_short: A British man living in New York sees his life crumble when his work visa is denied, in Glenn Gaylord’s “I Do.”

results.headline: A Father-Son Outing Goes Terribly Wrong

results.summary_short: “Fill the Void” is about a young ultra-Orthodox Jewish woman who is placed in an uncomfortable predicament.

results.headline: Abruptly, She Lets Down Her Hair

results.headline: Greek Hero in an All-American Tale
results.summary_short: “A Green Story,” inspired by real events, is about a Greek immigrant who succeeds because of all-American hard work and an early belief in the green movement.

results.headline: Literary Lion and a Very Good Sport

results.headline: Blood Despite Kinship
results.summary_short: “Aurangzeb” weaves Bollywood tropes — twins separated as babies, parent-child reunions, crosses and double-crosses — with contemporary outrage at the rules of the game.
